section.title: Function
section.p: One of the user authorization properties.
Enables the SQL standard authorization mode for the database or system on which this property is set. The possible values are:

li.p: SQL authorization for the database or system is enabled, which allows the use of GRANT and REVOKE statements.
SQL authorization for the database or system is disabled. After this property is set to TRUE, the property cannot be set back to FALSE.

section.note: If you set this property as a system property before you create the databases, all new databases will automatically have SQL authorization enabled. If the databases already exist, you can set this property only as a database property.
section.p: uses the type of user authentication that is specified with the derby.authentication.provider property.

If the derby.authentication.provider property specifies NATIVE authentication, behaves as if derby.database.sqlAuthorization were set to TRUE, regardless of how derby.database.sqlAuthorization has been set by other means.
For more information about user authorization, see "User authorizations" in the .

section.title: Dynamic or static
section.p: This property is static; if you change it while is running, the change does not take effect until you reboot.
